meanings.definition: The act of structuring or arranging something.
meanings.sent1: His structurations of the Lego blocks created a tall tower.
meanings.sent2: The structurations of the bookshelves made the room look neat and tidy.
meanings.sent3: She joked that her structurations of the grocery items in the cart were like a game of Tetris.
meanings.sent4: The structurations of the city's skyline resembled a futuristic artwork.
meanings.sent5: The structurations of the puzzle pieces made it challenging to put together.

meanings.definition: The way in which something is structured or organized.
meanings.sent1: The structurations of the essay were clear and easy to follow.
meanings.sent2: His structurations of the project timeline helped everyone stay on track.
meanings.sent3: The structurations of the party decorations gave the room a festive atmosphere.
meanings.sent4: Her structurations of the garden pathways were like a maze of beauty.
meanings.sent5: The structurations of the company's hierarchy were well-defined.
